required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Evaluating Sedation of Intravenous Administration of HSK3486 Injectable Emulsion in ICU Patients Undergoing Mechanical Ventilation
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Single-Blind, Propofol-Controlled Phase III Clinical Study Evaluating Sedation of Intravenous Administration of HSK3486 Injectable Emulsion in ICU Patients Undergoing Mechanical Ventilation

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, randomized, single-blind, propofol-controlled phase III clinical study. In this study, ICU patients undergoing mechanical ventilation are expected to be enrolled and will be randomly assigned to the HSK3486 group and the propofol group.

primary_outcome.description: 1) The time period during which the RASS is in the range of +1 to -2 accounts for ≥ 70% of the total duration of study administration and 2) Remedial treatment is not used.

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the percentage of time period during which the RASS is in the range of +1 to -2 relative to the total duration of study administration

the loading doses of HSK3486 and propofol, mean maintenance dose and total dose per unit weight per hour of HSK3486 or propofol, and the number of dose modifications and the number of top up doses during the maintenance period

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose of remedial drugs per unit weight
secondary_outcome.description: the mean dose per unit weight per hour of other sedatives used to maintain the target sedation (RASS within +1 to -2 points)

the time from intubation (applicable to patients who undergoes intubation after entering the ICU)/ICU admission (applicable to patients with intubation before entering the ICU) to extubation or the time from drug discontinuation to extubation
the time for the subject to recover from sedation to full recovery of consciousness (RASS ≥ 0) after discontinuation of drug administration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day -1 to 24 hours after administration

intervention.description: Loading Dose：0.1 mg/kg, infused with 4 min ± 30 s； Maintenance Dose：Maintenance is started at 0.3 mg/kg/h, and the dose can be adjusted up and down by 0.05-0.1 mg/kg/h. Range of maintenance dose: 0.06-0.8 mg/kg/h

Loading Dose：0.5 mg/kg, infused with 4 min ± 30 s Maintenance Dose：Maintenance is started at 1.5 mg/kg/h, and the dose can be adjusted up and down by 0.25-0.5 mg/kg/h. Range of maintenance dose: 0.3-4 mg/kg/h

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Sun Yat-sen University
